website_summaries.verdict: Durable, absorbent diapers that    have a great adjustable fit and stay put on crawlers and walking babies.
pros: The firm grip of the adjustable tabs makes these stand out as the ideal solution for babies on the go
Many consumers also felt these were an excellent choice because they kept leaks at bay overnight
We also love the value for the price
cons: Some customers felt that diapers were not soft enough

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY FROM THESE
customer_reviews.text: **WARNING** We used these since the baby was born and recently the design changed. Within a week the baby started developing a bad rash. We swore it couldn't be the diapers and took him to the doctor. Tried creams and powders with no luck. Finally we tried different brands. We got amazon mama bear brand and within a few days he was clearing up and happy and patting his butt like he was happier with the diaper. I feel so bad it took over a month before we tried a different brand. STAY AWAY.
customer_reviews.author: James Ace

customer_reviews.title: Same as before if not better
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order after seing some bad reviews but I actually found them to be almost exactly the same as the older ones . The print is the only difference that’s noticeable and it feels a little softer . Seems to absorb just as much as before if not better . I love these for night time use so u only use at night . Some reviews mention a smell . They smell the same as the older ones and air out easy
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Only diaper worth buying for little boys
customer_reviews.text: As a mom of soon to be three boys under 5, I only use Huggies. For some reason, a little boy can find a way to pee out of any diaper you put on them, except for Huggies. I've tried every other brand from Walmart to Honest Co. and we are brand loyal now to Huggies. Usually I'm a pretty generic loving kind of person, but this is worth the extra small amount for brand name.
customer_reviews.author: KFraed

customer_reviews.title: bad quality
customer_reviews.text: am not sure if huggies sold the brand or what happened. I wish I had listened to previous reviews. pls take this as a warning and stay away, you will be soooooo disappointed if u buy. I guess the positive review people never used huggies before. I have used it for years and I know what they used to be. little snugglers was my favorite until recently they changed it to something.... too low a quality, one can tell just from the new box. I decided to give little movers a try. it was a move from the frying pan into the fire. I guess am done with this huggies. Moving on without huggies till they bring back the QUALITY.
customer_reviews.author: BloodOfJesus

customer_reviews.title: Just PERFECT!! :)
customer_reviews.text: Just like any parent I was looking for the most comfortable, good quality and affordable diapers. Ive tried tons of brands no need to mention names! now we have 3 boys and I can rest assured that I will not think about changing my opinion about this as long as the quality is the same!! On 2019 Huggies released a new look for Little movers and great that the quality is just the same. My boy is 2 years and infant is 7 months I know it might be hard to believe but yes both wears size 6 and it fits like a charm no leaking and it lasts all night long :)
customer_reviews.author: Al.

customer_reviews.title: What's that?
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what's that, it's like an insect or something similar. It suppose to be clean.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra

customer_reviews.title: Our absolute favorite diapers
customer_reviews.text: My son is 18 months old. Throughout his life so far we have tried Pampers, Honest, Huggies Snugglers and Luvs. These are by far the superior of them all. Yes, they are a little more expensive than Luvs, but these diapers are so nice and thick, soft on the skin (my son has sensitive skin) and they comfortably hold a lot more urine. These little movers are way better than the snugglers, but we absolutely love these and have stuck with these for a long time now.
customer_reviews.author: Genna Mainardi

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to inspect diapers make sure they are clean
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I have bought these diapers and had a problem idk if they are sittin in the warehouse to long or get wet but they had what appeared to be mold on the inside of the diapers so I tossed them this happened once before and I was sent a replacement and they were fine but this just aggravated me that the next batch I received also had mold or spots I can’t believe these are being sold to families and expected to be put on our babies and toddlers
customer_reviews.author: MaryBeth

customer_reviews.title: Mold  with in the diapers
customer_reviews.text: Many diapers in the box are with mold, this is really bad for my baby please check very well and remove from inventory.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for skinny babies
customer_reviews.text: These were the perfect solution for my tiny 6 month old that has major blowouts. Other size 3 diapers were too big and the poop would shoot out the top. Size 2 diapers were too small and just couldn't hold all of it, so would squish out the top as soon as I laid him down. These have a tight stretchy waistband, but a big booty to hold it all. I've also noticed that they absorb a lot of the poop. With other brands, the poop would just pool on top of the diaper padding.
customer_reviews.author: NebraskaMamaTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Use to be so great
customer_reviews.text: We use to love huggies but we have been getting defective diapers. I pulled a piece of hard plastic out of the band that goes around the waist. Last week I went to open one and there were hard white strings hanging on the outside of the band. Also have had a few leaks in the size 4 diapers when she is sleeping. The whole front had a yellow line, the back had a little blue, but the rest had leaked onto her bed and pjs. What's going on huggies? For being as expensive as they are, they shouldn't have these issues. One more defect and I'm switching
customer_reviews.author: ~Niki

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I personally love Huggies for my one-year-old son. He can do a big wet diaper and it is very good. What time being chunky and big for his age it was hard to find comfortable diapers but the Little Movers are the best thing to buy especially now that he's walking and thinning out. Will highly recommend and it came the next day perfect timing when you're busy and can't go out to the store
customer_reviews.author: Amber-Ze'Na

customer_reviews.title: Quality is not the same
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if Amazon got diapers that didn't pass some kind of quality control, but these cost just as much as usual and were junk. I couldn't use probably 30 to 40% of the diapers because the side tabs would just tear off while trying to put the diaper on. Then we had multiple leaks at night which never happened with the diapers purchased from the actual store because the tab would tear off in the night and the diaper would be half off in the morning. This may be more convenient, but the quality of these versus the ones you buy from like walmart is night and day and they cost the same so that's unfortunate.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Formed a Bad Rash
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these, they fit great, and do their job when it comes to everything else. My wife and I started noticing a really bad rash my son was getting while using them. I don't know if it's the material that they are made with, but we went to a different brand and his rash started to go away. Unfortunately, I won't be buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: My favorite brand
customer_reviews.text: Huggies have been great from size 1-3. They are really nice in the beginning stages before you introduce solids because I feel like they hold the most mess in. They also seem pretty comfortable. They are definitely thicker than Target brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Chunky baby’s friend
customer_reviews.text: Huggies little movers are best for chunky babies. If you need to size down for less chunky baby, but not quite size down an entire size, opt for Huggies little snugglers. Beyond that, you just need a stretchy waistband on the diaper to avoid blowouts (esp. with breastfed babies). Huggies has that. Tried a cheaper brand to hold us over while waiting for Huggies to arrive. Definitely spent more money in stain remover than it would’ve cost to just buy another case of Huggies.
customer_reviews.author: Country boy

customer_reviews.title: Love Huggies Brand
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't describe diapers as a potty training tool which is why i gave 1 star mainly because that doesn't make sense. But for a diaper huggies are great! I love the extra tabs to hold them in place. I find that's a huge plus over other brands that do not have the extra tab. Huggies have also always provided my kids with better leak protection as well. A bit pricy, but a necessity so it is what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chemical Burns!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these diapers for well over a year now and got a recent box (size 5 and 4) for my kids and both kids broke out in horrible rashes, continuously. It became very apparent that my oldest was having a chemical burn reaction from The welts that appeared on his legs along the ruffle line. Horrible! These have been our go to diapers for so long but now we have to switch brands! So immensely disappointed in Huggies.
customer_reviews.author: txsunshine

customer_reviews.title: Always come back to these
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried so many diapers but always come back to these nothing else compares and I know I can trust the quality every single time. Definitely feel comfort in knowing I will always get my good diapers. I’ve tried pampers hello hello honest amazon mama bear and other huggies but these are by far the best in my opinion. My super active 8 month old won’t rip them off as easily because of the double Velcro security tabs. Love them can’t say enough good things.
customer_reviews.author: Daysi

customer_reviews.title: Best Huggies diapers on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I love this version of Huggies diapers for my actively growing 9 month old. She had the worst rashes while using other kinds of Huggies, like the Snug and Dry and even the Little Smugglers as a newborn. The value of this product is alright, considering you get less of these "specialty" ones compared to other versions of the same Huggies brand, but the mere fact that my baby's bottom is no longer raw, red and she's not screaming her little head off, makes it worth the little extra cost worth it for me. They are thinner front to back, and that has allowed for more airflow and relief for her little behind.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 2, and Loving It!

customer_reviews.title: Hives and rash
customer_reviews.text: I buy diapers from amazon all the time. First diaper from this package caused hives all over his thighs and anywhere the diaper touched. Loads of benedryl and over an hour later they started to go away. Same reaction twice. When compared to a previous batch the dark purple mark looks like a solid thick line in the ones that cause a reaction and look like two smaller purple lines in the ones that don't. Probably knock off diapers. Horrible
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Huggies have been our go to diaper for the last 4 years. We have tried other brands but have decided Huggies works best for our children. My kids have never had a skin allergy to these (they have with other brands) and they have been great for absorbing and not leaking. I would highly recommend this diaper brand. Currently we love Huggies little movers and Huggies pull ups!!
customer_reviews.author: Bearness

customer_reviews.title: Great Diaper and well made
customer_reviews.text: I NEVER purchase anything else!!!! The tab system was a genius invention. With other disposable diapers, I still use diaper pins just to keep the sides secured. I don't know quite how to describe the issue, however with out that second security a disposable diaper on an active 2 year old leaves the underside of the diaper unsecured and eventually hanging below the tabbed side. This is the closest thing to how a real cloth diaper fits a baby I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Gram Cookie

customer_reviews.title: These diapers work well - for the turbo crawler and new walker both!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! We had our baby girl in this size for about 4.5 months before she outgrew them, and they never leaked! We're pretty good at checking and changing her disper regularly, but occasionally she'll have a TON of poop or a blow out (runny poops), and the diapers never leaked! They also didn't leave marks on her unless we failed to change her for too long (which was rare, thankfully). I can definitely recommend these diapers. I think the price should come down though. Huggies should lower the prices on all of their diapers, or at least earn discounts (dollars off) more quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Marie33kl

customer_reviews.title: Great Deal, Great Diaper
customer_reviews.text: These are the best diapers I have ever used and I’ve tried em all. I go through much less than when I’ve used the cheaper brands because little movers just absorb the most. They are stretchy enough that you can pull them down to use the potty without undoing them completely but they are just one step below little movers slip-ons for me. But I am a bargain momma and this is the best deal out there for quality, longevity and price. And they are the best for overnight!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality gone downhill - rash so bad that little one has been crying so constantly
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if the issue is within the current batch of quality in general. We have always order Huggies for our little one and he has never shown any discomfort with the diapers until the latest batch of March 2020 (Size 4). These diapers have caused a very bad rash, the skip has turned blood red and the little one has been crying incessantly. I am going to send these back and request for a refund but at the same time, I am going to request Amazon not to re-sell these to someone else as it may hurt someone else's baby. Also, I think its time to give other diaper brands a try.
customer_reviews.author: Stuti N.

customer_reviews.title: Good use
customer_reviews.text: We switched to these from the Pampers brand. Pricing was better and the fit as well. They absorb plenty. Our 2.5yr old son is still not potty trained and likes to unload in these diapers so maybe they’re too comfy. They can take his payload tho and easy fold up to toss out.
customer_reviews.author: CRB

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING DIAPERS!
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT understand any of the negative reviews!!! Do not listen to them please. I am a mom of 2 and expecting my 3rd in 10 weeks. I've been using Huggies forever because Pampers brands were not ideal for me at all! I normally use snug and dry, but they ran out so I gave these Huggies style a try. They absorb very well, strong, great coverage, secure, nice thick plush material, just simply amazing diapers!!!!!! You will not regret it. I actually now prefer this style over snug and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Classy C

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers after Huggies Snugglers
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are very similar to the Huggies Snugglers and I've been ordering them instead since the Snugglers are no longer available lately to purchase at the usual rate from Amazon. The only difference that I noticed between the two diapers is that the Movers are a little thinner but I've never had an issue with leaks. My baby loves wearing these and I'll continue purchasing these diapers unless the Snugglers become available again from Amazon (then I'll purchase both diapers). The Movers do not have a chemical smell nor do they bother my baby's skin as I've noticed other users have claimed.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Update: been using them for about 2 weeks now without any issues, No complaints at all! I'm Not sure why ppl are 🤔 having issues with them, I think they really are Great 🤷‍♀️ I was very skeptical with all the negative reviews, but to my pleasant surprise THEY ARE GREEAAATTT!!!👍👍👍 No leaks no rips, fits perfectly. Fits better then snug and dry Huggies. Hope this helps 😊
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Quartieri

customer_reviews.title: "New" diapers leak from ENTIRE diaper
customer_reviews.text: I have pretty much been exclusive Huggies for the last 3 years. After their "new" change, the diapers leak THROUGH THE ENTIRE diaper. You might as well wrap a towel around your baby, that is how effective the new Huggies diaper is. I will have just changed the diaper and set my daughter on my lap and her bum feels wet on my leg; and sure enough, the entire diaper feels saturated like I haven't changed her in hours. It's not even leaking from the sides... it's the ENTIRE diaper leaking! Will no longer purchase Huggies ever again and I will tell everyone I know to never purchase. This product is disgusting, rip-off, and an absolute disgrace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers. Box is bigger than it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Box is bigger than it usually is. Great quality. Only diapers I like that actually fit and stay put on my toddler. All the others ride down in the front where the front flap goes under the tabs. These have the reinforced purple Velcro-like patches on the hips that make sure it doesn’t budge so NO LEAKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Leaks & Smells
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these diapers for a while and decided to buy on Amazon because they are cheaper than the local stores. First time, I thought maybe I got a bad batch of diapers then the same thing happened with the next batch. I never had a problem before buying them on Amazon. The diapers don't hold much and if baby poops his clothes smell like it. I've switched to another inexpensive brand, that I found on Amazon, and we haven't had a problem with leaks or smells. Note: We change baby's diaper often, so the leaks and smell weren't from leaving it on longer than it is intended to be worn.
customer_reviews.author: Butterfly89

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers AND best price
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are EXTREMELY absorbent. They last a very long time. 144 diapers are a lot more than you think. The Little Movers are very nice. I genuinely do feel like they move with the child. And buying in bulk you save about $3-$5. In the video I made I mentioned overnight diapers. They are in a blue box and they are called ‘Huggies overnight diapers’. If you’re having a problem with your child leaking at night, try these out.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Velcro irritates lil guy's upper thighs, gets rash
customer_reviews.text: Somehow the purple velcro always irritates my 20 mo old's thighs, no matter what I do, best situation was if I dog ear the front tabs upward and then attached the outer securing tabs, but he didn't want to stay still for that!!! Going back to Snug and Dry (much better, no extra velcro)..Also like target's honest and the 7th gen diapers. Maybe it's my guy's shape of butt and thighs but maybe this helps someone else.
customer_reviews.author: GrnLadyBee

customer_reviews.title: Item defect
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box and found out it’s missing 1 plastic bag unit(27 diapers). On the outside of the box, number 5 is written and I assume it’s intended to indicate one missing unit.
customer_reviews.author: Hae Jin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great diaper and price!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using honest company for year and recently decided to switch to Huggies after an inpatient hospital stay where they provided my toddler huggies. They are so soft and the double sticky section is really what sold me! He’s a diaper escape artist and hast figured out how to get out of these yet! I also like the price point now that we have two in diapers!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Not for my little.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 3 boxes of these since my little one became active, they leave marks on her sides where you secure the diaper. I have mentioned it in one review and ppl suggested to go up a size. I did with the 3rd box for the 3rd try and still did. So I went back to the snug and drys with no problem. Absorbancy is great but I also have never had a problem with her snug and drys leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Shandy McGinley

customer_reviews.title: Poor design not the same design
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these once, normally order a different box size from different vendor. These did not have the same closure design. These are awful!!!
customer_reviews.author: DocPsych

customer_reviews.title: Causing a Rash
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these diapers for my twins for over a year and always loved them. The new diapers are horrible! Both my girls have developed a rash over their backside and have been walking around scratching. The diapers also have a distinctive chemical smell when they come out of the package. Huggies has lost this customer. I drove to Walmart this afternoon and bought a box of Pampers.
customer_reviews.author: Jenw

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, absorbent
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to order these after seeing several reviews mentioning rashes and a chemical odor but we are almost through our pack and have had no issues with these diapers. We have previously bought them from Babies R Us, Costco, and Target, and the only thing I noticed that was different was the print. It’s the same great fit and absorbency and our daughter had no issues with rashes in them. We are working on potty training so hopefully we won’t be needing another box but if we do, I’ll definitely buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers for Little Movers!
customer_reviews.text: After my son started cruising at 10 months we switched him over to Pampers Cruisers, however I had to change his diaper 3 times at night and even then he would wake up soaked in pee some nights. Switched over to Huggies Little Movers and it has been the best decision ever! Only one diaper change at night and they dry up quickly (no sagging diapers or wetness). Hands down worth the extra money they cost.
customer_reviews.author: dian.her.

customer_reviews.title: Leaks!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers cut pretty big (I'm used to Huggies Special Delivery) and with 2 pees you smell the urine. Don't leave it on your baby too long or else it will leak. 2, maybe 3 pees max! I would suggest going a size down if you're trying these for the first time or else your "little mover" will pee straight out of the corners of these huge diapers lol
customer_reviews.author: Kaila Winston

customer_reviews.title: Prevents leaks
customer_reviews.text: My son has used Huggies diapers since he was born but we always used the Little Snugglers because they were sensitive diapers. My son didn't have any skin issues but I just felt better having him use those versus non-sensitive brands. However, since he's a very active child, we started noticing he was leaking out of his diapers so decided to try these since they're supposed to move with him. Well...it worked. No more leaks and still great quality Huggies diapers.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: HATE IT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to try it for my baby and it gave her a really bad rash! I opened it and threw the boxes away otherwise would try to return it. I am never buying Huggies again. Back to Pampers Swaddlers, the trusted brand!! Not sure what they are adding to their products that would cause a rash like that. My baby has never had diaper rash, I have even used cheap Target brand UpandUp diapers and she was fine. Parents please do not use this!
customer_reviews.author: Salman

customer_reviews.title: Huggies family
customer_reviews.text: Always a fan of Huggies products. These are great diapers for kids who are not frequently soiling their diapers. They do not leak but they sag and buldge. I love that they have the color indicator. I prefer the little movers because they fit more snug around the waist but for the price difference, I always get these. These sometimes tear at the tabs when pulling them around the waist so you have to be easy when putting it on but I've never had a problem once they are on.
customer_reviews.author: Dannielle Price

customer_reviews.title: New design horrible!
customer_reviews.text: Just like the other one star reviews I read, I experienced the same issues. I've always used Huggies and was very satisfied, but they recently changed their design and it's horrible! I have twin boys and they both developed rashes on their bellies and inner thighs. The diapers also leaked, they literally fell apart and the jelly stuff was everywhere! These issues never occured until Huggies changed their design. I won't use these anymore and would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Converted
customer_reviews.text: From the beginning with our first child we have always been a pampers swaddlers family. But now I think we have been swayed to these huggies with child number two. The gusseted back of these just seems to hold solids in much better so there are no horrible surprises and I think they are better over night at absorption. They just seem sturdier for my little mover who is up and walking now.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Hope

customer_reviews.title: Great Diapers overall!
customer_reviews.text: I love huggies diapers I decided on these as a first time mom when my little one was still in newborn size, after trying various other brands. They are more affordable than say honest brand diapers but far better than their leading competitor Pampers. My biggest PRO above pampers is the elastic on the back of the diapers = far less blowouts!! I do have a heavy wetter and still searching for the best overnight diapers for her, so we can get over that early morning wake up because of needing a diaper change. Although, i know my babe is a little more on the heavy side with how much she goes.
customer_reviews.author: SamanthaRH

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot for these to leak.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent diaper. If you don't wanna worry about leaks or blowouts, consider getting these. My daughter is 14 months. I can count on my one hand how many leaky Huggies diapers she's had. When she was a newborn, she wore the little snugglers diaper. There were a few blowouts with those but with newborns, it's sometimes unavoidable. I can't say the same for other brands. And I've tried a lot of other brands. I'm not fond of the chemical smell but it generally isn't very bothersome in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great tailored fit, super absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We exclusively use Huggies because of the absorbency and great fit. We’ve tried many other brands but they stay wet to the touch, these are instantly dry. We switched to these from “Little Snugglers” when my baby starting crawling and being more active. These are thinner and more tailored. I would recommend them for daytime and snugglers for nighttime.
customer_reviews.author: Bermet Suominen

customer_reviews.title: Great diapers, and good value!
customer_reviews.text: For us, Huggies are the diapers to have! They are the only diapers that my son can wear overnight, for 12 hours, and we can expect that there won't be a single leak! A few other brands seemed to rub red spots on his legs, but not these. Highly recommend. We had trouble with Pampers leaking constantly. We've been using huggies for 8 months, and we've probably only had 3 leak through, which is pretty great in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Better than Pampers, In More Ways Than One
customer_reviews.text: The stretchy rear waist on these things is genius. I'm sad I didn't learn to appreciate those until our second child. Oh how many blow-outs we could have avoided. Also genius? The extra "sticky" locations on the front of the diaper. They provide twice as much hold and more evenly distribute the "load" on each of the four "sticky" locations: 2x on the front that end up almost on the hip bone, and 2x on the back tabs that come around and stick right under the belly button.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Size 3 leaks almost every night
customer_reviews.text: Size 3 leak almost every night and sometimes after only a few hours. They are also peeling off pieces of the diaper onto baby during the day. Baby still has nine pounds in this size so it isn't a matter of being close to the next size. Not only does it take away the little sleep we get by waking him up early, but he has to lie there in wet clothes and sheets until he fully wakes up. I am going to try the larger size in a much smaller package that he isn't technically in yet to give Huggies one more chance. Customer service was great on a separate issue though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff R

customer_reviews.title: Great for active babies!
customer_reviews.text: These work great for my little. I prefer huggies vs pampers because they fit my babies chunky legs better. The little movers have more leak protection than the snugglers. Since my little one is always scooting everywhere and close to crawling, these work great for us. Havent had a blowout yet.
customer_reviews.author: Randi Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Not using this brand anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Huggies for over 2 years now with my first kiddo and it wasn't until I switched from pampers pure to Huggies little movers with my 10 month old that I experienced this issue, but I will not be using this brand anymore. The diapers have hard clumps that feel like there are small rocks inside. I actually thought that my son had multiple hard bms and was shocked when his diaper was still clean. I also have found 2 diapers now with a sharp piece of something poking through. I don't feel at all comfortable using these. The quality of Huggies has clearly changed.
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: All my kids use
customer_reviews.text: My two little ones have always used these diapers. They never complain about them. They have great absorption which every parent knows is a need. Even putting a fresh one on in before bed, these still absorb all the liquids. They are great. I do the subscribe and save. And the cost cannot be beat even against Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew A.

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTMENT CUSTOMER!
customer_reviews.text: I have used Huggies since my son was born, he's 2 now. WHY CAN I NOT FIND THE HUGGIES LITTLE SNUGGLERS SIZE 5 ANYMORE? I had to purchase these little movers. One word..gross. They have a bad smell to them. Once they are wet...worst smell ever!!! Cheaply made!! What happened manufacturer....you have dropped the ball?! So so disappointed. Now what?? Wish I had never stopped the subscription from originally purchase. I need to find the Huggie Snugglers! Please help! Disappointed customer.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob T.

customer_reviews.title: These have the pee line
customer_reviews.text: For those who can't tell when their kid pees, it has the line that goes from yellow to blue when wet. I also spent $10 extra dollars compared to what I would have paid if I had bought it at the store. Was spending an extra $10 worth not having to wear a mask at the store though? Possibly.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Bad new design. Blow out poop through the sides!!!
customer_reviews.text: They must have switched the design of the diaper, the purple box Huggies Little Movers worked great for my twins. The new red box is terrible. Every single poop is a blow out poop. So much poop! And laundry! And unneeded stress. My boys are always blowing out the side.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency, but bulky!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grand daughter (24 lbs), and slightly petite. Thought these would be a better fit for around her legs and through her waist, as they say “our most tailored fit” on the box. Assumed that these would fit her smaller legs better, but they are much more bulky, and seem to gap in the leg and through the back area, much more than the “Snug & Dry” version. Wetness indicator, softness, and absorbency are great overall. They are just a very bulky diaper, and I just don’t prefer how they fit her. Won’t be purchasing these again at this time.
customer_reviews.author: CaraBella72

customer_reviews.title: Absorbent and leak proof!
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these diapers for a while and have been pleased overall in regards to leak protection and absorbency. The only thing I dislike is that the diapers get squishie when wet. It seems I have to change as soon as the first pee or they will really get squishie.
customer_reviews.author: P Vazquez

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the cheapest
customer_reviews.text: These have been my glfavorite diapers until just recently that I realized that they cost twice as much as the target brand, and are pretty much the same quality. So far, target brand (up&up) is winning, because they cost half as much.. We shall see if I still love them in a few months... To be continued!
customer_reviews.author: Iliena Popow

customer_reviews.title: The brand I prefer
customer_reviews.text: I like huggies and have used them for each child I have had. These in particular are the best ones. I normally buy them from the local store however due to Covid I am unable to buy them. They are slightly more expensive on amazon but they just work so much better than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea  Henry

customer_reviews.title: Runs small for weight
customer_reviews.text: So I know the weight descriptions say this is good for older babies, but I use it for my 8 month old and it fits great. I would add though that sometimes i feel odor and leak protection could be improved since there have been "instances". But overall our baby is comfortable wearing this. So we would continue using Huggies.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Hassaan

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency
customer_reviews.text: Love these diapers- perfect for little ones on the move. We tried them all and this brand was the only one that worked well with our daughter. Great absorbency and they are soft on their skin.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany T

customer_reviews.title: Definitely order these online
customer_reviews.text: These Huggies are exactly like what you buy in the store without the hassle i’m having to go to the store and then possibly not having the diapers in stock! I am so happy I can have you delivered to my door and they are exactly like the product description! The best part is they come so fast I have been very very happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Ashley S.

customer_reviews.title: Best Diapers in the Game
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER buy another brand of diapers ever again. Huggies by far has the best diapers when it comes to leak protection, no diaper rashes, and comfort! This kind especially (the little movers) for those babies that are crawling and walking. Worth the little extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Mandii Mew

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Something is off with this; it is not the same Huggies quality I have known of the last few years. They work fine but the smell is awful and they stick together as if there is some sort of glue on the outside. I have to tear apart every diaper from the stack.
customer_reviews.author: Johnothan Hallman

customer_reviews.title: Those tabs get stuck on everything/run small compared to pampers
customer_reviews.text: I normally buy pampers but I had to buy these last minute when I some how ran out. Long story short they run small compared to pampers and I was not impressed with their tabs for easy pull ups, not only because am not ready for that yet but because it’s a hassle when those tabs get stuck to everything and anything around. Let’s just say I won’t be buying them again.
customer_reviews.author: timothy a best

customer_reviews.title: BEST DIAPERS!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best diapers. Don't buy the cheap ones that leave your baby's bottom feeling wet when you take the diaper off. My baby's bottom is virtually dry even when she wakes up in the morning! Totally worth the price and if you can afford a months supply you are really getting a bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.author: Savannah

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: First off, 1 in every 10 diapers had broken tabs. Leak guard was no better than other brands. Also, worst of all was if the tabs weren't placed absolutely perfect they cut into his poor little leg. This led to unknown fussiness until we saw the red mark when we gave him a bath. I've tried 6 other types of diapers and will be trying them over again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Zarbeck

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Love this line of diapers, as much as you can love a diaper. Added to my subscribe & Save to save 20% and is the lowest price you can find for them. Highlights: - no leaks - poop flap on back - fit well - good price
customer_reviews.author: KpCrumpet

customer_reviews.title: Best diapers on the market. Better than pampers
customer_reviews.text: The best diapers on the market so far! Very secure. You can never keep a child from leaking overnight if they pee a lot! And for boys it all leaks out of the front all of the time and we just have to wait for potty training. These are the least saggy and do not give my children rashes often. It is unavoidable with sensitive skin of course. I will be using these until they are out of diapers
customer_reviews.author: devon chapman

customer_reviews.title: Too tight around the waistline for 28 lbs baby
customer_reviews.text: Ok so this size 5 diaper is for kids 27 above pounds. This can’t be true! My child is 28lbs and I was looking for a diaper that would wrap his entire waist so that he wouldn’t leak from the side. Well, the waistline is tight for a 28 pounder child. I would definitely recommend upping the size and buying size 6 instead although it says size 6 is for 35lbs +.
customer_reviews.author: T_Y

customer_reviews.title: SOAKS IT ALL UP😂
customer_reviews.text: Ive always been a Huggies buyer from diapers-wipes, but Ever since switching to the little movers I CANT GO BACK! Let me tell you, these are thee BEST for BOYS !...or any hyper toddler for that matter. They NEVER LEAK even when ed to capacity. ⭐BONUS FEAUTURE: The Material doesn't wear or tear ! BUY BUY BUY !🤑💰💵
customer_reviews.author: 🎼ymphony 💖.

customer_reviews.title: causes RASH
customer_reviews.text: We have been using pampers since my 18month old was born. I just ordered this box of Huggies to try them out. Our baby girl has had a really bad rash since she started wearing these. I bought a whole box and I can't use them. Its almost like a burn... there is something in the diapers that needs to be banned. I will never use them again.
customer_reviews.author: waterbaby

customer_reviews.title: Not the same huggies at store bought huggies.
customer_reviews.text: Big difference in these huggies than the ones I buy at the store. These ones are very rough (not soft like store bought ) and not absorbent as huggies bought at stores. Also the leg hole area breaks my child out very badly. It almost looks like a chemical burn. Not sure why there's a difference but I wouldn't purchase again from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: My favorite diaper brand
customer_reviews.text: I really love Huggies as diapers! They are leak-proof and just fit my baby's body really well. I've never really had any crazy blowouts with them like I've had with pampers or 7th generation. These are my go-to diapers. The only thing I don't like about these diapers is that they can be a little bit bulky on the crotch area
customer_reviews.author: Afrocurlitan

customer_reviews.title: Last few boxes have sucked
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with the last few boxes we have gotten of huggies. The material used lately sucks! I just put a diaper on my daughter (size 3, only 17lbs) and right away she peed and the pee just went through the diaper and all over her jumper. Because of the last few times of getting huggies being terrible we will be switching to Pampers. Huggies once you fix the material, we will switch back.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Hastings

customer_reviews.title: only pampers that work for my litle guy
customer_reviews.text: we have tried many pamper and they all seem to be less superior to these. These have been the only ones we have stuck with and continue to buy and recommend. they fit well and my little guy tends to be smaller framed and these do not slip off of him at all. definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Padilla

customer_reviews.title: Size 3 smells like metal
customer_reviews.text: They’ve changed. I used to buy size 2 and my first box of size 3 was fine then my second and third box had a metal smell to them. I thought my son had an infection because of how strong it was and I didn’t smell it unless he’d peed. Not sure what the smell is but I’m no longer buying these from Amazon. I’ve bought them from Kroger and never had an issue with smell...so maybe amazon gets rejects or something that’s why they are cheaper? Who knows , just not worth the risk. (Otherwise these diapers are my go to for my super active 9 month old. Great for overnight too no leaks!)
customer_reviews.author: Arianna

customer_reviews.title: For babies during the day
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this one since my LO was about 1 years old and likes to move around. Honestly speaking I think I still like the little snugglers a lot better because they are a lot softer and the absorbency is better. My toddler is now 18 month we still use it during the day. Still it is a decent product. Leak protection is better.
customer_reviews.author: Merzhu

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best for preventing leaks!
customer_reviews.text: These diapers are our favorites! We tried lots of other brands and our son would per through them Every. Single. Night. Waking up in a wet bed got old very fast. We switched to these diapers and have had one or two diapers leak in over 6 months of us using this type. The little movers and the little snugglers are the best. I like them even better than pampers which are more expensive for a smaller package.
customer_reviews.author: Samira

customer_reviews.title: Love these for my toddler
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Huggies little movers for both my kids as soon as they start crawling. My daughter was always underweight and now my son is chubby, so definitely works on both baby bodytypes. I've never had an issue with leaks during daytime or overnight. They also have the strip to indicate when wet. Cute patterns too!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Ayn & Noel

customer_reviews.title: New design is terrible
customer_reviews.text: Leaking ! I thought my son could possibly be a size 5 . Bought the same size and brand elsewhere and had no issues . Maybe this is why they are listed so cheap 🤨
customer_reviews.author: Michele Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: Love these diaper! Better than Pampers by far. They have a snugger fit so buy a size bigger. But they are super absorbent and they draw moisture away from baby’s bottom. Worth spending the extra money even if you just use them at night or when you need to run errands.
customer_reviews.author: A. Millett

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Fit
customer_reviews.text: We have tried almost every diaper on the shelf and these are by far the best. From no leaking to always fitting comfortably on our daughter. Other diapers have straps that leave red marks around her waist but these have a soft waist band to prevent that. You can also feel comfortable leaving your baby in these over night we have had no problems if we put her in a fresh diaper before bed she will be good until the morning.
customer_reviews.author: Billie Kollman

customer_reviews.title: Great for huge pees and poos
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried hello bello, target brand, all the pampers, sams club brand, nothing compares to the durability of these for my toddler’s huge pees and poos.
customer_reviews.author: 2times

customer_reviews.title: No rashes from these.
customer_reviews.text: They are super absorbent during the day. But they do tend to leak from time to time at nighttime. I'm sure a lot of diapers do, but she doesn't have a bad reaction to THIS PARTICULAR huggies. Any other one or other brands we have tried, both of my daughters have had rashes from any other brand or type. It must be these Huggies.
customer_reviews.author: A. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: wasn't a fan at all
customer_reviews.text: The velcro on the diaper made cuts onto my daughter's legs
customer_reviews.author: Micki

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT purchase; New RASH
customer_reviews.text: I have used huggies little movers since December 2017, I ordered them for the first time on amazon one week ago. Without a doubt, something terrible has changed. Within two days, my daughter (who never gets rashes) developed red, irritated thighs. I didn’t connect the two, and kept using them for a couple days. The rash has since progressed to bright red and broken skin all over her private area and bottom. I don’t know what they did to these, but it’s cheap and absolutely terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Igor S.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit
customer_reviews.text: I like these diapers much more than the snug and dry. The price is good and they are comfortable, not scratchy like the snug and drys. They are absorbent and if you get the right size, they won’t leak at all! I think it’s worth it to pay a bit more than the snug and dry’s, luvs, and parents choice to make my baby comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Severe allergic reaction to diaper
customer_reviews.text: Loved the protection of the diaper but whatever it is made of did not agree with my babies bottom. She is raw and in so much pain. She has never had this problem before! Always a happy baby but is crying so much every time she is changed.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Huggies definitely made a different line of dialrrs for Amazon because these are not the same , soft, super absorbent huggies I've always known and loved. Now they feel like a cheap generic brand. Buy at Costco instead !
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR A WILD CHILD :)
customer_reviews.text: If you have a rambunctious toddler like I do these are the perfect diapers for you! They stay in place through all the running, jumping, and playing. Also love these in the night! We have tried so many different diapers but these are by far our favorite for this toddler stage. Th extra Velcro helps so much. Never had a leak or blow out. Also my baby is super sensitive and these never have given a rash!
customer_reviews.author: Briley

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, easy, rarely leaks
customer_reviews.text: I feel like each size diaper is different. When my baby was a newborn only pampers would work. Then size 2-3 I used parents choice. And now size 4, Huggies are the best for him. very comfy. Easy to use. Velcro is perfect. Perfect size. Rarely leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Barboza

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We have always used Hello Bello diapers, but for some reason I wanted to try another brand so I chose these. They are thin and do not absorb any kind of odor. I will be switching back to Hello Bello asap.
customer_reviews.author: KLTate

customer_reviews.title: Absorbency for the win
customer_reviews.text: We are a huggies family! These little movers diapers work the best for our little mover! The only time we’ve ever had a blow out was when he was sick. They absorb a LOT...cause I may have forgot to change him a couple times and we’ve never had a leak or anything
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Hardin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!!
customer_reviews.text: I was previously using Huggies special delivery diapers for my 10 month old and reluctantly switched to these to save money, but I’m so happy that I did! They keep my baby dry and happy!
customer_reviews.author: MorgansMom7348

product_meta.title: Huggies Little Movers Baby Diapers, Size 4, 144 Ct, One Month Supply, Packaging May Vary
product_meta.description: Style:One Month Supply Pack| Size:4Huggies Little Movers Baby Diapers are designed for moving babies, with Double Grip Strips that hold the diaper in place during active play. Our #1 Fitting Diaper,* Little Movers feature a contoured shape and SnugFit Waistband for the perfect fit. Huggies DryTouch liner absorbs wetness on contact, while the absorbent Leak Lock System helps eliminate leaks for up to 12 hours of protection. Little Movers also feature a wetness indicator that changes color when wet. Plus with Huggies SizeUp indicator, you'll know when it's time for baby to move up to the next diaper size. Little Movers disposable diapers are hypoallergenic, fragrance free, lotion free, paraben free, and free of elemental chlorine & natural rubber latex. Little Movers Diapers are available in sizes 3 (16-28 lb.), 4 (22-37 lb.), 5 (27+ lb.) and 6 (35+ lb.). Join Huggies Rewards to earn 10 points for every dollar spent on Huggies diapers and wipes. Points are redeemable for products, gift cards, sweepstakes and more. You'll also receive exclusive diaper coupons, offers and updates. Buy diapers in bulk with Subscribe & Save to ensure you always have Little Movers as your baby explores the world. (*Wet Fit, Among Open Diapers)
feature_bullets: Huggies Little Movers diapers size 4 fit babies 22-37 lb. (10-17 kg)
#1 Fitting Diaper features a contoured shape to move with your active baby and virtually eliminate leaks (Wet Fit, Among Open Diapers)
Huggies DryTouch Liner absorbs wetness on contact while baby is crawling, moving or walking
Huggies SnugFit Waistband & Double Grip Strips help keep the diaper in place for your active baby, while SizeUp indicator lets you know when baby is ready to move to the next size diaper
Fragrance free, lotion free, paraben free, and free of elemental chlorine & rubber latex. Disposability - do not flush

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
